Animals Module¶

A file with the animal class. The file also contains subclasses Herbivore and Carnivore.

class biosim.animals.Animals(age=0, weight=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The main class for animals. This class contains all the methods that are shared for all species of animals. Each animal has access to _ani_params_ to use for performing basic tasks.

This constructor initializes the parameters of each new animal. These parameters are updated later in each subclass. If the age and weight arent specified, a new animal is created with age 0 and a randomly chosen weight from normal distribution. :params age: the start-age of the animal. :type age: int :params weight: the start-weight of the animal. :type weight: float

aging()[source]¶

Ages an animal’s age by 1 each year.

birth(cell, number_animals=None)[source]¶

Calculates if an animal gives birth. :params number_animals: number of the relevant species in that cell. :type number_animals: int :params cell: the relevant cell. :type cell: object

Returns

True if it gives birth.

calculate_fitness()[source]¶

Calculates the fitness of an animal and returns that value. :return: The animal’s fitness.

change_weight(weight_change=None, birth=False)[source]¶

A versatile class method to change the weight of an animal. If it is called without parameters, it decreases the weight of an animal by the yearly weight loss. If it is called with a weight_change =! 0 it increases the weight of that animal by the amount it eats. If it is called as a result of giving birth, it reduces the weight of the animal by the child’s weight.

Parameters

  • weight_change (float) – Weight of food eaten.

  • birth (boolean) – True if it gives birth.

death()[source]¶

Calculates the probability that an animals dies based on its fitness and weight. :return: True if the animals dies.

class biosim.animals.Carnivore(age=0, weight=None)[source]¶

Bases: biosim.animals.Animals

This is a subclass of Animals. It replaces parameters defined in the main class, and gives the Carnivore its basic parameters: species, age, weight and fitness. This class also has a method for hunting herbivores. It inherits other methods from Animals.

This constructor initializes the parameters of each new animal. These parameters are updated later in each subclass. If the age and weight arent specified, a new animal is created with age 0 and a randomly chosen weight from normal distribution. :params age: the start-age of the animal. :type age: int :params weight: the start-weight of the animal. :type weight: float

hunt_herbivores(herbivore_fitness, carnivore_fitness)[source]¶

This method decides if a carnivore is able to capture and eat a herbivore. It returns true if that happens.

Parameters

  • herbivore_fitness (float) – The fitness of the hunted herbivore.

  • carnivore_fitness (float) – The fitness of the hunting carnivore.

Returns

True if the carnivore catches the herbivore.

classmethod set_carn_params(new_params=None)[source]¶

Sets or changes the parameters for the given animal

Parameters

new_params (dict) – the new parameters

class biosim.animals.Herbivore(age=0, weight=None)[source]¶

Bases: biosim.animals.Animals

This is a subclass of Animals. It replaces parameters defined in the main class, and gives the Herbivore its basic parameters. It inherits the methods of Animals.

params: species, age, weight and fitness.

This constructor initializes the parameters of each new animal. These parameters are updated later in each subclass. If the age and weight arent specified, a new animal is created with age 0 and a randomly chosen weight from normal distribution. :params age: the start-age of the animal. :type age: int :params weight: the start-weight of the animal. :type weight: float

classmethod set_herb_params(new_params=None)[source]¶

Sets or changes the parameters for the species.

Parameters

new_params (dict) – the new parameters
